title: If yasuo is too strong just nerf him, dont nerf the crit items cause of yasuo
body:
Building crit seems to be viable again on adcs and even the likes of Jinx are now finally playable.

But as a side effect yasuo now has a 54% win rate top lane.

Please, for the love of god, DONT NERF THE CRIT ITEMS BECAUSE OF HIM, warlords has already been trashed multiple times when it was fine on adcs because of him, just nerf his passive or whatever already and let adcs have viable items for once, dont fking dumpster the whole class again because of 1 champion.

replies.body: Why don't they just ditch his double crit chance? Then sit back and watch how he does, and balance him appropriately. His double crit chance doesn't seem crazy important to his kit, but  makes the crit meta work around him.

It is actually because otherwise you'll just make him build tanky/juggernaut like since building full crit to gain the right damage output isn't worth it. 

Something that's very mobile and very hard to kill is very cancerous.

But at least an entire line of items wouldn't be balanced around that single champ. I guess maybe make his mobility cooldown scale off AD? IDK. That champion is well designed but seems like a balance nightmare.

Crit is not balanced around Yasuo. He needs it but it's not like the entire item group is balanced around him. 

But if you must say that crit is balanced around the crit based melee carries, then don't ignore Tryndamere's crit synergy.
The key difference is that Tryndamere's kit is garbage, and Yasuo's kit is overloaded.
That doesn't excuse ignoring the other guy that _actually_ gains free crit.

But he cant abuse it as much as Yasuo can. Trynd has only 1 gap closer and no hard CC. Yasuo has 2 gap closers (E and ult) , 2 hard CC (Q and ult), a passive shield which recharges with movement, and I think you are forgetting that Yasuo _actually_ gains 50% free crit.

Trynd also has to work for his crit. Yasuo spends 3400 gold ({{item:3087}} {{item:1018}}) or 2000 gold ({{item:1018}} {{item:1018}} {{item:1051}}) and has 100% crit chance. 

So basically what a normally crit based champion (like Caitlyn or Jinx) spends on 1 crit/damage item with only a 20% crit chance ({{item:3031}} or {{item:3508}}), he can buy a crit/attack speed item and a 20% crit item for the same price and gains a full 100% crit chance. That is why crit is an issue on him.

Sure Trynd has some crit built into his kit, but he has to earn it, and it does not give him 100% crit chance, just 35%.

> But he cant abuse it as much as Yasuo can. 

WTF are you talking about? How is he abusing when Yasuo has been designed to buy crit items? 

> Yasuo has 2 gap closers (E and ult)

You listed his Ult as a gap closer, are you serious? It's extremely conditional. So he has only 1 viable cap closer.

> 2 hard CC (Q and ult),

His Q is telegraphed, slow and easy to dodge from distance. And again ult - not only it's conditional, but Yasuo can't do anything else during his ult.


> a passive shield which recharges with movement, and I think you are forgetting that Yasuo actually gains 50% free crit.

Yasuo is a skirmisher and he NEEDS this.


Also you completely skipped how low Yasuo's base stats are, which his kit has to compensate for.


> t. Yasuo spends 3400 gold ( ) or 2000 gold (  ) and has 100% crit chance.

Are you fucking serious? Not only Yasuo should build PD, but 2 Cloacks of Agility?



> So basically what a normally crit based champion (like Caitlyn or Jinx) spends on 1 crit/damage item with only a 20% crit chance ( or ), 


ADCs are ranged, Yasuo is not. ADC has to stay away, Yasuo has to go all in right into enemy team. Both are equally squishy. 

> That is why crit is an issue on him.

Nope it isn't.

One thing i find frustrating is the fact that he gets double crit and a free shield, how about we attack one of those? Like make the shield disappear when his windwall is use rather then a free shield and windwall, or how about scaling crit so he cant just rush two items and stomp everyone.

I've always felt that Windwall lasts too long. It's a cool skill, that should reward skillful use (and punish randomly using it). But it has a long duration that can block far too much. 

Maybe 2 seconds would be fine. It would feel a lot less terrible to play against if he gets ahead.
This is much better proposition than any so far.
Imo the only reason Trynd is played with Crit is because of his ult. If he didn't have the invincibility he couldn't build crit and wreck teams with it.
No shit, Sherlock.
Then why do you bring him up?

Only if they did it wrong...... yep lets not try that!
In all honesty though, Yasuo should  be an early/mid game champ that falls off. Not a late game monster. The high skill cap is wasted on a champ that will simply outscale his difficulty. Giving him a resource, removing his double crit and making him scale like an AD caster instead of a melee {{champion:67}} would do wonders for lowering his frustration IMO

> His double crit chance doesn't seem crazy important to his kit, 

Sure, dealing damage isn't important for Yasuo at all.
Only champion with double crit chance deal damage?
Squishy skirmisher who has to go all in into the enemy team? Yes it's pretty important for him.
As I said, then he could get buffed in other areas.
Like where?  Making him not squishy?  That's worse.
I don't know man. I'm not a designer. But I do know that plenty of other squishy assassins/fighters function just fight without double crit chance.
And they aren't Yasuo.
So what is exclusive to Yasuo's kit that makes him crit dependent?

Whats so special about Yi being immunie to slows? Or Mundo healing for a ton? Or Cho'gath being super big and tanky?

Nothing, none of it is fucking special and they could get a whole new ability. But its *part* of their kit, and the identity the champion has.

You can't just remove shit you personally dont like. I would say double crit on Yasuo is the least of his problems.

His passive and Q, auto attack reliance, **squishiness**, no innate sustain, unreliable CC, somewhat conditional mobility.


Don't forget that he has reduced crit dmg for exchange.

Other skirmishers function just fine without 2x crit chance BECAUSE they have other damage steroids to make up for it. 

Aatrox has 2 forms of AS boosts, his W and his passive gives base AD (synergy with steraks). 

Yi has the most damage steroids out of any skirmisher and probably champion in the game too. He does have 0 cc or anything remotely looking like utility though.

What could possibly compensate the nerfs for reduced dmg?

This isn't a simple buff/nerf. Minirework is what you are talking about.

Only champion who's entire kit is based around him *having* a bunch of crit.

Remove that any Yasuo becomes a basic bitch, Mobile Tank melee characters whos *actually* fking annoying because unlike normal Yasuo, you can't just CC and kill him.

{{champion:82}}  would like to have a word with you when it comes to THAT designer and reworks...

To a *degree*, that isn't his fault entirely. He was told to rework Morde, a champion who needed a complete VGU, with only a Class Update allocated amount of resources. Notice how Skarner, who Riot Rep was in charge of, faced the same exact problems, as Skarner is also in the boat of needing a VGU. He had to find a way to change Morde's problems, without changing his theme, so he was forced to change gameplay instead. 

Now, were the ideas faulty. Yeah, but I it's honestly not completely his fault. Dude was given a hard task with limited resources for changing things. It's like being asked to fix a bridge with only duck tape and glue.
I dunno. Duck tape is pretty strong. Just the quacking that gets annoying.
